Description: Hemispherical brown clay jar-seal: with the pottery lid of a jar adhering to the base. It bears two impressed inscriptions crossing at right-angles over the top, showing the repeated name of Den and the name of the official Hemaka. The impression of the royal name occurs again around the sides, whilst the name of Hemaka is repeated at the extreme bottom edge, although much of this impression is missing. Surface treated but in poor condition.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pl.XXV, 56; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. XVIII, 136; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pls.56, abb.203B; see also vols. I, 100 and II, 758, n.532; 1119, 1123.
